EARTH

Earth is the third planet in the solar system and is the only one known to host life. It is composed of a variety of ecosystems, from vast oceans to high mountains. Its atmosphere is primarily composed of oxygen and nitrogen, which enables the existence of a diversity of life forms. Earth is a unique place in the universe and is essential for the survival of humanity and many other species.

MOON

The Moon is the Earth's only natural satellite and has fascinated humanity for centuries. It is a celestial body without a significant atmosphere, and its surface is covered with craters, mountains, and plains. The Moon plays a significant role in Earth's tides and has been a target of space exploration. It was visited by astronauts in various missions of the Apollo program in the 1960s and 1970s. The Moon continues to be a subject of study and a source of inspiration for science and space exploration.
